arts.ttl: Serie A | Torino 1-1 Genoa: Match Report
arts.sum: Torino's curious run of form continued as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Genoa at the Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. The Granata extended their unbeaten streak since December 21, but have only managed one win in their last six matches. arts.ttl: Serie A | Torino v Genoa: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Torino head coach Paolo Vanoli has made significant additions to his squad in the final days of the winter transfer window, potentially reshaping his team for their upcoming Serie A fixture against Genoa. New arrivals Cesare Casadei, Eljif Elmas, and former Fiorentina skipper Cristiano Biraghi are all in contention to feature in Saturday's match The post Serie A | Torino v Genoa: Probable starting lineups appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Torino face Genoa to leave the relegation battle.
arts.sum: Since the start of last season Torino have kept the joint-most home clean sheets in the big five European leagues, keeping 17 in 30 home games (level with Real Madrid - 17 in 29 matches). Only Monaco (13) have seen a higher number of different nationalities of player score for them across the big five European leagues this season than Torino (12 – level with Brighton).

arts.ttl: Torino Coach Vanoli Addresses Schuurs’ Exclusion and Team Updates
arts.sum: In a recent press conference, Torino’s head coach Paolo Vanoli provided insights into the club’s current situation, addressing the exclusion of Perr Schuurs from the Serie A list and updating on other player conditions. Regarding Schuurs’ omission, Vanoli explained, “It was a coincidence, we still have two slots. You know we still have an operation pending, which is Ilic’s.” He reassured that Schuurs is continuing his rehabilitation, stating, “We’ve sent him to his specialist to help him overcome this ordeal. arts.ttl: Milan Reach Agreement with Ricci: Torino’s Price Tag and Inter Rivalry
arts.sum: AC Milan have taken a significant step towards securing their top summer transfer target, Samuele Ricci, by reaching a personal agreement with the Torino midfielder. The 23-year-old Italian international has emerged as Milan's primary objective for the upcoming transfer window, with the club's leadership unanimously approving his profile.
